title: Simone de Beauvoir - The Second Sex & other works (7 books)
description:
SIMONE DE BEAUVOIR (1908-1986) was a French writer, intellectual, existentialist philosopher, political activist, feminist and social theorist.  She did not consider herself a philosopher but had a significant influence on both feminist existentialism and feminist theory.  Beauvoir wrote novels, essays, biographies, an autobiography and monographs on philosophy, politics and social issues.  She is best known for her 1949 treatise THE SECOND SEX, a detailed analysis of women's oppression and a foundational tract of contemporary feminism, which is here presented in two translations.


The following books are in PDF format unless otherwise indicated:

* BRIGITTE BARDOT AND THE LOLITA SYNDROME (Four Square Books, 1960).  Translated by Bernard Fretchman.

* A HISTORY OF SEX (Four Square Books, 1961).  Translated and edited by H. M. Parshley.

* LETTERS TO SARTRE (Arcade, 2011).  Translated and edited by Quintin Hoare. -- ePUB

* THE MANDARINS (Flamingo, 1993).  Translated by Leonard M. Friedman. -- ePUB

* THE PRIME OF LIFE (Penguin, 1965).  Translated by Peter Green.

* THE SECOND SEX (Alfred A. Knopf, 2010).  Translated by Constance Borde and Sheila Malovany-Chevallier. -- ePUB

* THE SECOND SEX (Jonathan Cape, 1956).  Translated and edited by H. M. Parshley.
